page.title: 06Buxhall - Natural History
page.content:
The{landscape}is dominated by arable fields. There are few boundary or roadside{hedges,}except in the High Town Green area where some roadside belts of trees remain. Along many of the{roadside verges}financial restraints on highway maintenance have enabled a variety of wild flowers to bloom. There are two noticeable{woods in the area. The owner of one is introducing a management scheme with coppicing for firewood.
Most{ponds}within the cultivated area have been filled but some remain associated with dwellings, several of which are on moated farm sites. Many houses have enough land to keep a variety of{domestic livestock}for pleasure eg donkeys, ornamental ducks and pheasants, peacocks or to supplement income eg chickens, goats.
